intro: Limonium wrightii, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the United States. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its spikes of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes and coastal grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to withstand salty air and strong winds. Limonium wrightii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
